gurmukhi: iPir khXo kwih bolq n pUq ] cup rhy rwj lihkY ksUq ]29]
transliteration: Phir(i) Kahyo Kaahe Dolat Na Poot|| Choup Rehe Raaj Laihkai Kasoot||29||
translation: They again said, “O son ! Why do you not speak?” The king, fearing his reply to be unfavorable, again remained silent.29.

gurmukhi: niRp dIE pwn iqh pws jwie ] cik rhy AMD iqh kr Cuhwie ]
transliteration: Nrip Deeo Paan Tih Paas Jaae|| Chak(i) Rahe Andh Tih Kar Chhudaae||
translation: Coming near them, the king gave them water; then on touching his hand those blind persons, .

gurmukhi: kr kop kihXo qU Awih koie ] iem sunq sbd niRp dXo roie ]30]
transliteration: Kar Kop Kahiyo Too Aah(i) Koe|| Im Sounat Sabad Nrip Dayo Roe||30||
translation: Getting bewildered, asked angrily about his identity. Hearing these words, the king began to weep.30
The speech of the King addressed to the Brahmin:

gurmukhi: h`au puqR Gwq qv bHmxys ] ijh hinXo sÍx qv suq sudys ]
transliteration: Hau Poutra Ghaat Tav Brahmnes|| Jih Haniyo Sravan Tav Sout Sudes||
translation: “O eminent Brahmin ! I am the killer of your son, I am the one who hast killed your son.”

gurmukhi: mY prXo srx dsrQ rwie ] cwho su kro moih ib`p Awie ]31]
transliteration: Mai Daryo Saran Dasrath Raae|| Chaaho Su Daro Moh(i) Bipp Aae||31||
translation: “I am Dasrath, seeking your refuge, O Brahmin ! Do to me whatever you wish.31.

gurmukhi: rwKY qu rwK mwrY qu mwr ] mY pro srx qumrY duAwr ]
transliteration: Raakhai Tu Raakh Mdarai Tu Maar|| Mai Daro Saran Toumrai Duaar||
translation: “If you want, you may protect me, otherwise kill me, I am under your shelter, I am here before you.”

gurmukhi: qb khI ikno dsrQ rwie ] bhu kwst Agn dÍY dyie mMgwie ]32]
transliteration: Tab Kahikino Dasrath Raae|| Bahu Kaasat Agad Dvai De(i) Manade||32||
translation: Then the king Dasrath, on their bidding, asked some attendant to bring good deal of wood for burning.32.

gurmukhi: qb lIXo AiDk kwst mMgwie ] cV bYTy qhwN slR kau bnwie ]
transliteration: Tab Leeyo Adhik Kaasat Manade|| Chad Baidhe Tahaan Sal Kau Banaae||
translation: A great load of wood was brought, and they (the blind parents) got prepared the funeral pyres and sat on them.

gurmukhi: chUM Er deI juAwlw jgwie ] idj jwn geI pwvk isrwie ]33]
transliteration: Chahoon Or Daijuaalaa Jagade|| Dij Jaan Gadpaavak Siraae||33||
translation: The fire was lighted on all the four sides and in this way those Brahmins caused the end of their lives.33.

gurmukhi: qb jog Agin qn qy aupRwj ] duhUM mrn jrn ko sijXo swj ]
transliteration: Tab Jog Agad(i0 Tan Te Oupraaj|| Duhoon Maran Jaran Ko Sajiyo Saaj||
translation: They created the fire of Yoga form their bodies and wanted to be reduced to ashes.

gurmukhi: qy Bsm Bey iqh bIc Awp ] iqh kop duhUM niRp dIXo sRwp ]34]
transliteration: Te Bhasam Bhae Tih Beech Aap|| Tih Kop Duhoon Nrip Deeyo Sraap||34||
translation: Both of them reduced themselves to ashes and in their final hour cursed the king in great anger.34.
The speech of the Brahmin addressed to the King :

gurmukhi: ijm qjy pRwx hm suiq ibCoh ] iqm lgo sRwp sun BUp qoh ]
transliteration: Jim Taje Praan Ham Sout(i) Bichhodh|| Tim Lago Sraap Soun Bhoop Toh||
translation: “O king ! The manner in which we are breathing our last, you will also experience the same situation.”
